item.title: Engineering VP Josh Clemm on how we use knowledge graphs, MCP, and DSPy in Dash
item.description: üöÄ Engineering VP Josh Clemm recently shared insights on Dropbox’s use of knowledge graphs, MCP, and DSPy during a session in Jason Liu‚Äôs RAG course on Maven. He discussed how Dropbox Dash integrates with third-party apps, allowing users to easily search and manage their content. For a deeper understanding, check out the full video on Maven! #DropboxDash #KnowledgeGraphs #TechInnovation #MavenCourse #AI

item.title: Inside the feature store powering real-time AI in Dropbox Dash
item.description: üöÄ Dropbox Dash is leveraging AI to enhance how we search and organize our work. By using a feature store, Dash ranks and retrieves relevant files quickly, adapting to user behavior across various content types. This system is essential for effective collaboration and improves access to important documents and conversations. The development of this feature store was tailored specifically for Dash, addressing unique infrastructure challenges and ensuring speed and efficiency. #DropboxDash #AI…

item.title: Building the future: highlights from Dropbox‚Äôs 2025 summer intern class
item.description: This summer, Dropbox welcomed 43 interns as part of the 2025 Camp Dropbox Intern Program. üåç They came from 27 colleges, including six international institutions. Over 12 weeks, interns worked on impactful projects, especially related to Dropbox Dash, our AI-powered search tool. They received over 6,000 hours of mentorship and participated in various community-building events. ü§ù Interns shared their experiences, highlighting technical achievements and personal growth throughout their time at…

item.title: How Dash uses context engineering for smarter AI
item.description: üöÄ Exciting advancements in AI are here with Dash! Initially a traditional search system, Dash has evolved into an agentic AI that interprets and acts on user requests. This shift emphasizes the importance of context engineering‚Äîdelivering the right information at the right time. As Dash incorporates new tools, the focus remains on providing relevant context to enhance decision-making. With these developments, teams can streamline their workflows and improve project management. #AI…

item.title: With Mobius Labs' Aana models, we're bringing deeper multimodal understanding to Dropbox Dash
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news from Dropbox! They’ve partnered with Mobius Labs to enhance Dropbox Dash‚Äôs AI capabilities. With the integration of Aana models, Dash will improve its understanding of photos and videos, making it easier for teams to access and analyze their multimedia content. This multimodal processing will help users get answers faster without sifting through multiple tools. Stay organized and efficient with Dropbox Dash! #Dropbox #AI #MobiusLabs #Multimodal #Productivity

item.title: Half-Quadratic Quantization of large machine learning models
item.description: üöÄ Explore Half-Quadratic Quantization (HQQ), a new method for compressing large AI models without needing calibration data. This technique significantly speeds up quantization, processing models like Llama-2-70B in under 5 minutes‚Äîover 50x faster than traditional methods. HQQ maintains competitive compression quality, enabling efficient deployment of large language models. #MachineLearning #AI #Quantization #HQQ #Llama2

item.title: A practical blueprint for evaluating conversational AI at scale
item.description: Building effective conversational AI involves more than just training models. At Dropbox, we discovered that structured evaluation is crucial for accuracy. üõ†Ô∏è Initially, our evaluations were ad-hoc, but as we refined our processes, we developed a standardized approach to assess every change rigorously. This evaluation-first mindset is now part of our workflow. üìä We created a playbook detailing datasets, metrics, and tools to help others implement this method across various media types,…

item.title: Hack Week 2025: How these engineers liquid-cooled a GPU server
item.description: üöÄ Hack Week 2025 at Dropbox focused on the theme ‚ÄúKeep It Simple,‚Äù encouraging innovation and collaboration. One highlight was the “Liquid Cooling CPU/GPU Hardware” project, which won the Learn Fast award. The team developed a custom liquid cooling system for GPU servers to address the thermal demands of AI workloads. This system demonstrated significant benefits, including lower operating temperatures and quieter performance. Future plans include expanding testing across multiple data…

item.title: Driving AI adoption at Dropbox: a conversation with CTO Ali Dasdan
item.description: üöÄ AI is transforming how Dropbox operates, enhancing productivity for engineers. In early 2025, a shift occurred, leading to over 90% AI adoption among engineering teams. This change was driven by leadership alignment and a culture of knowledge-sharing. CTO Ali Dasdan emphasizes AI’s role in automating tasks and allowing deeper focus on coding and innovation. #AI #Dropbox #Productivity #Innovation #TechTrends
